conference_notes:
• Data quality is a key element to know the real impact of agricultural policies.
  • Data must be standardized so this quality is ensured.
  • Data literacy is also a key element, as many stakeholders do not know how to read the data and therefore impact is not clearly identified, especially at the subnational or local level.
  • Data producers need feedback on the data they publish.
name: Open Agricultural Funding: Breaking Down Silos
info: Agricultural data is important because of a number of reasons: investment, innovation, accountability, SDGs measuring… in this session some of these issues were raised

tweets.content: @opendatacon: Room F is discussing now how to open agricultural funding #IODC16pic.twitter.com/qNEwtBOG5d

session.description: Open agricultural funding: breaking down Silos
